Today, Dan and Jordan dip into the past to look at the ways that Alex's response to the beginning of the 2009 H1N1 outbreak closely mirrored his response to the beginning of Covid. Also, Alex goes on Coast to Coast, and tries to call the White House.

*Alex's coverage of H1N1 outbreak
*Alex's response to health crises is always the same
*[[Jason Bermis]] show: The Info Warrior

*Mexico is supressing the number of dead

==Detailed Show Notes==

Topics covered<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2022/1/13/episode-636-april-27-2009 Episode #636: April 27, 2009]</ref>:

*Alex's early reaction to the beginning of the 2009 H1N1 outbreak is reviewed and compared to many of the early reactions he had to the beginning of the Covid outbreak in early 2020
*[http://dehai.org/archives/dehai_archive/apr-jun09/0090.html PJW's 2009 article] suggesting that H1N1 may be a bioweapon
*Transcript of [http://edition.cnn.com/TRANSCRIPTS/0904/26/cnr.03.html Gen. Honoré on CNN]
*[https://www.cdc.gov/h1n1flu/information_h1n1_virus_qa.htm Explanation] of why it is not that weird that the virus had parts from three different lineages
*[https://www.uchicagomedicine.org/forefront/biological-sciences-articles/where-does-the-flu-come-from-every-year University of Chicago article] about where flus come from
*Baxter [https://www.webmd.com/cold-and-flu/news/20090720/swine-flu-vaccine-when did not] provide all the vaccines for the US, but [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2009/oct/11/swine-flu-vaccine-baxter did get in trouble for Medicare fraud]
*Tamiflu producer Gilead [https://finance.yahoo.com/chart/GILD was not having record profits] in 2009
*Kurt Nimmo's [https://web.archive.org/web/20090401015500/http://www.infowars.com/us-air-force-study-proposed-2009-influenza-pandemic-in-1996/ Infowars article] about Air Force 2025
*The actual [https://web.archive.org/web/20011030172851/http://www.au.af.mil/au/2025/index2.htm Air Force 2025 report]
*Transcript of [https://www.dhs.gov/news/2009/04/26/press-briefing-swine-influenza Napolitano's press conference] about H1N1
*Fox News' [https://www.foxnews.com/story/signs-point-to-milder-swine-flu-outbreak-than-once-feared non fear-mongering story] involves the same sources as stories from [https://www.npr.org/templates/story/story.php?storyId=103678167 NPR] and [https://www.cnn.com/2009/HEALTH/05/01/swine.flu.outbreak/index.html CNN], and many others
*[https://www.who.int/influenza/resources/documents/FluCheck6web.pdf WHO checklist] about influenza preparedness
